name: relocation
content:

the act of moving or moving something or someone from one place to another, or an example of this: We are likely to see the temporary relocation of some of our staff. The relocation of the memorial from the centre of Tallinn to a military cemetery on the city's outskirts provoked riots. Career advances can mean many relocations. See
relocate
More examplesFewer examplesThe business is considering relocation.The war has caused the forced relocation of tens of thousands of people. We offer relocation assistance and on-the-job training.Residents vowed to fight for relocation of the factory.
